FuncDef: The display pim rp-info command displays information about rendezvous points (RPs).

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about the RP that serves a specified multicast group.
group-address specifies a group address.
The value ranges from 224.0.0.0 to 239.255.255.255, in dotted decimal notation.

Displays information about RPs in all instances.
-

Displays information about RPs in a specified VPN instance.
vpn-instance-name specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of case-sensitive characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view information about static RPs and bootstrap router (BSR) RPs, run the display pim rp-info command. The command output includes the RP address, RP priority, address of the group that the RP serves, and the length of time the RP has been Up.
Precautions
If neither vpn-instance nor all-instance is specified, the command displays information about RPs in the public network instance.
